docs.snippet: TWO new-rate international postal cards had their first-day sale in New York on June 10, each a revision of an earlier postal card and each concerned with America as a vacationland and a place to visit.
docs.lead_paragraph: TWO new-rate international postal cards had their first-day sale in New York on June 10, each a revision of an earlier postal card and each concerned with America as a vacationland and a place to visit.
docs.abstract: Grenada issues stamp to hon Miss World J Hosten; stamp illus

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 -- An effort to free the kidnapped British Ambassador to Uruguay, Geoffrey Jackson, through the good offices of Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, the Socialist President of Chile, has failed.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 -- An effort to free the kidnapped British Ambassador to Uruguay, Geoffrey Jackson, through the good offices of Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, the Socialist President of Chile, has failed.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt bars efforts to free Jackson through offices of Chilean Pres Allende; diplomatic activity began 2 wks earlier with offer from Chilean Min Almeyda while on visit to London

headline.main: URUGUAY BARS HELP ON ABDUCTED BRITON

byline.original: Special to The New York Times
Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 6 -- The urban guerrillas of Uruguay have apparently decided to avoid upsetting the nationwide elections scheduled for November.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 6 -- The urban guerrillas of Uruguay have apparently decided to avoid upsetting the nationwide elections scheduled for November.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros apparently modifying tactics; have avoided terrorism in last 6 mos and offered qualified backing to pol alliance called Broad Front while maintaining that such stand does not conflict with conviction that power can never be won through elections; Amb Jackson still being held; some Tupamaro sympathizers suggest he is being made hostage to guarantee elections, others assert holding him for almost 6 mos is in itself challenge to Uruguayan Govt

headline.main: Urban Guerrillas in Uruguay Seem to Have Modified Tactics

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- "There will have to be blood," said the high-school boy, standing in a classroom Tuesday night and almost trembling with intensity. "We've learned that we cannot get the changes we want without violence.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- "There will have to be blood," said the high-school boy, standing in a classroom Tuesday night and almost trembling with intensity. "We've learned that we cannot get the changes we want without violence.
docs.abstract: Extreme radicalization of large majority of Uruguayan high-school and college students into warring bands of left and right, with balance overwhelmingly to the left, discussed; 16 mos of student protests and clashes with police credited with forcing Pres Pacheco to withdraw Govt control from ind council governing pub schools

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- This is the 19th winter of economic depression and political confusion in Montevideo, and it may be spring before even the shape of change begins to show.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- This is the 19th winter of economic depression and political confusion in Montevideo, and it may be spring before even the shape of change begins to show.
docs.abstract: Current econ and pol scene, Montevideo; illus

headline.main: Shabby Montevideo Looks for a Scapegoat

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 9 -- There is a new political force in Uruguay that has been called, depending on personal viewpoints, the country's last and only chance to avoid civil war, a new method of revolutionary mobilization and a Trojan horse that...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 9 -- There is a new political force in Uruguay that has been called, depending on personal viewpoints, the country's last and only chance to avoid civil war, a new method of revolutionary mobilization and a Trojan horse that could bring Communists to power here.
docs.abstract: Pol platform of gen leftist Broad Front discussed; group has brought together liberal nationalists, Caths, revolutionary Socialists and Communists and has surprisingly come up with strong showing in pub opinion polls and at rallies; Front Pres candidate Gen Seregni terms plan 'advanced democracy,' neither socialist nor Marxist, and aimed at breaking Uruguay's econ dependence on other nations; Front began to form last yr at height of Govt-Tupamaro struggle

headline.main: Left-Leaning Bloc in Uruguay Mounts Vote Drive

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Pres Pacheco Cabinet re-imposes special security laws less than 24 hrs after Cong has voted to repeal them, triggering major confrontation between Pacheco and Cong; special laws have been used as basis for holding suspects without charges, banning...
docs.abstract: Pres Pacheco Cabinet re-imposes special security laws less than 24 hrs after Cong has voted to repeal them, triggering major confrontation between Pacheco and Cong; special laws have been used as basis for holding suspects without charges, banning demonstrations and other pub activities considered threat to Govt

headline.main: Mrs. Joseph H. Ziluca, 76, Dies; ] A Granddaughter of Garibaldi]

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: " I've had to do things to this country that no one ever should have to do," President Jorge Pacheco Areco told a visitor to Uruguay last year. He meant that he had felt compelled to impose drastic measures utterly foreign to South America's most...
docs.lead_paragraph: " I've had to do things to this country that no one ever should have to do," President Jorge Pacheco Areco told a visitor to Uruguay last year. He meant that he had felt compelled to impose drastic measures utterly foreign to South America's most durable democracy in an effort to recharge an economy plagued by inflation, inefficiency and strikes, and to maintain public order against the urban terrorism of the Tupamaro revolutionaries.
docs.abstract: ed on impeachment move against Pacheco warns against further pol polarization in Uruguay which may enhance election chances of leftist coalition
